name: GitHub
description: DataLad datasets can be hosted (without the data annex) on any Git hosting portal such as GitHub.

name: GitLab
description: DataLad datasets can be hosted (without the data annex) on any Git hosting portal such as GitLab.

name: git annex
description: DataLad datasets can have an annex, and thereby all the data versioning and transport features git-annex provides

name: git
description: DataLad datasets are Git repositories - anything compatible with Git also works for your datasets

name: GIN
description: DataLad datasets can be hosted on GIN (locally or in the cloud), and any data hosted on GIN can be accessed via DataLad.

name: Amazon Web Services
description: DataLad datasets can be "linked" to a wide range of data hosting portals, including AWS S3 and Glacier, to offload data online.

name: Box.com
description: DataLad datasets can be "linked" to a wide range of data hosting portals, including Box.com, to offload data online.

name: OpenNeuro
description: The OpenNeuro data portal uses DataLad for logistics, and provides access to all its data as DataLad datasets via GitHub.

name: CBRAIN
description: DataLad is a supported data provider on the CBRAIN platform at the McGill Centre for Integrative Neuroscience.

name: HeuDiConv
description: The DICOM conversion tool HeuDiConv uses DataLad to organize and version control its output datasets.

name: CBBS
description: The CBBS neuroimaging platform builds on DataLad to manage data capture, management, and analysis workflows.

name: brainlife.io
description: Hundreds of DataLad datasets are discoverable and immediately usable via the BrainLife dataset search.

name: EBRAINS
description: The Human Brain Project is establishing interoperability between DataLad and its EBRAINS infrastructure.

name: Virtual Brain Cloud
description: DataLad-based workflows and software adaptors interoperate with the Virtual Brain Cloud infrastructure for biomedical research.

name: NFDI-Neuro
description: The national research data infrastructure for neurosciences in Germany builds on a DataLad-based technical backbone.

name: CRC1451
description: DataLad underlies information management of the DFG collaborative research center on 'Key Mechanisms of Motor Control in Health and Disease'

name: JTRack
description: This remote wearable device monitoring platform uses DataLad to develop digital biomarkers for neurological and psychiatric diseases.

name: ReproNim
description: ReproNim uses and contributes to DataLad and its extensions for multiple projects, such as ReproMan, ReproNim/containers, and more.

name: TemplateFlow
description: TemplateFlow uses DataLad for organization, management, and contributions of teamplates.

name: CONP
description: The Canadian Open Neuroscience Platform (CONP) relies on DataLad for all data logistics and management of contributions

name: DANDI
description: The BRAIN Initiative archive for cellular neurophysiology data provides DataLad datasets for all its datasets (a.k.a. dandisets).

name: Courtois Neuromod
description: The Courtois NeuroMod project on neuronal modelling uses DataLad for data management and access.

name: Datalad MetaLad
description: This DataLad extension provides a command suite for extensive metadata handling, including extraction, aggregation, and reporting.

name: DataLad Neuro-Imaging
description: This extension enhances DataLad for working with neuroimaging data and workflows.

name: XNAT
description: The datalad-xnat extension allows you to track and update medical image acquisitions from XNAT servers

name: OSF
description: With the datalad-osf extension package, DataLad datasets can be hosted on the Open Science Framework.

name: DataLad Catalog
description: An extension to generate standalone web-based data catalogs from DataLad-extracted metadata

name: UK Biobank
description: The datalad-ukbiobank extension package represents UK Biobank data as extensible DataLad datasets.

name: PRIMAP2
description: PRIMAP2 is a free climate policy analysis suite, using DataLad for metadata extraction and data package management.

name: PASTA
description: This database for 'adaPtive mAterials Science meTa-dAta' uses DataLad for metadata capturing and synchronization.

name: Bitbucket
description: DataLad datasets can be hosted (without the data annex) on any Git hosting portal such as Bitbucket.

name: Gitea
description: DataLad datasets can be hosted (without the data annex) on any Git hosting portal such as Gitea.

name: Gogs
description: DataLad datasets can be hosted (without the data annex) on any Git hosting portal such as Gogs.

name: DataLad Container
description: This extension enhances DataLad to work with computational containers like Docker and Singularity.

name: Gautheron et al. 2021
description: Managing, storing, and sharing long-form recordings and their annotations, PsyArxiv.

name: Hanke et al. 2021
description: In defense of decentralized research data management, NeuroForum.

name: Halchenko et al. 2021
description: DataLad: distributed system for joint management of code, data, and their relationship, JOSS.

name: Markiewicz et al. 2021
description: The OpenNeuro resource for sharing of neuroscience data, eLife.

name: Wagner et al. 2021
description: FAIRly big: A framework for computationally reproducible processing of large-scale data, bioRxiv.
